title: Amanda Holden opts for stunning dress with matching crutches at Pride of Britain 2019

Amanda Holden looked sensational in black plunging dress with cerise ruffles among the red carpet arrivals at the Pride of Britain Awards 2019.

The 48-year-old Britain's Got Talent judge arrived hobbling on matching crutches as she said that she was looking forward to rewarding the real heroes from across the country.

She arrived at the glamorous event, which is held at the Grosvenor House in London with her radio co-host Jamie Theakston.

Other celebrities on the red carpet included I'm A Celebrity star Emily Atack, Love Islanders Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, Simon Cowell , the cast of Strictly Come Dancing and Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield.

(Image: Â©Karwai Tang)

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

This is the 20th anniversary year of the awards and Amanda arrived with her leg in plaster after breaking her leg in an accident while on holiday last week.

She returned to Heart FM this morning to co-host the breakfast show with Jamie.

The Pride of Britain Awards are hosted by Carol Vorderman, who sat on the judging panel, alongside Christine Lampard, Susanna Reid, Eamonn Holmes.

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

Pride of Britain celebrates extraordinary people from across Britain who have shown incredible bravery and spirit.

The winners are nominated by members of the public from all walks of life and from all over the country.

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm
